data: Establishes a lexical resource based on WordNet, which provides sentiment scores (neutral, positive, negative) to the independent meanings (synsets) of words.

It contains approximately 5,000 short text snippets, collected from financial news and press releases of Finnish companies traded on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet has been labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.
A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial text, which integrates artificial intelligence and semantic web technology to better identify, explain, and process opinions in this context.

It includes entity-sentiment annotation, which addresses the challenge of headlines containing multiple entities with potentially conflicting sentiments. This human-annotated dataset of over 10,700 news headlines provides insights into the variation of sentiment depending on the specific entity in financial news.

A dataset of tokenized and annotated Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts. This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

An annotated dataset of relationships between entities within financial documents, containing approximately 29,000 examples and 22 types of relationships linked to eight entity pairs (e.g., person-position, organization-money), extracted from SEC 10-X filings. Useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Compiled from various news sources and evaluated by human experts, which allows researchers to investigate how news headlines influence price movements, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial context, which helps identify and categorize financial companies within text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset with headlines of real-world financial articles in 15 languages. It is annotated with high-level and low-level topics, facilitating multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs with deep analysis of financial reports. Written by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning over financial data, providing training data for answering complex financial questions.
